meanings.definition: A fine, silky filament produced by certain mollusks for attaching themselves to rocks.
meanings.sent1: The byssus of the mollusk helped it stay firmly on the rock.
meanings.sent2: The mussel used its byssus to anchor itself securely in place.
meanings.sent3: The clam joked that its byssus was like a magical rope keeping it from floating away.
meanings.sent4: The byssus of the mollusk was as delicate as a spider's silk.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering byssus of the mollusk gleamed in the sunlight, a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A group of silky filaments by which certain bivalve mollusks attach themselves to rocks.
meanings.sent1: The byssus of the bivalve mollusks formed a strong bond with the rocks.
meanings.sent2: The rocks were covered in the byssus of the bivalve mollusks, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent3: The byssus of the bivalve mollusks held a secret dance party on the rocks.
meanings.sent4: The byssus of the bivalve mollusks intertwined like a web of friendship.
meanings.sent5: The byssus of the bivalve mollusks swayed gently in the ocean currents, a mesmerizing sight.
